com.adeptions.clarguments.arguments

Interface Argument<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - is the final type of the argument value
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractArgument, BooleanArgument, DoubleArgument, FileArgument, FlagArgument, InformationalArgument, IntegerArgument, StringArgument

    public interface Argument<T>
    Interface for actual arguments - containing value(s) found during parsing and whether the argument was found.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addInvalidValue(java.lang.String invalidValue)
      Adds a found invalid value for the argument
      java.util.List<T> getAllValues()
      Gets a list of all the values found for the argument
      ArgumentDefinition<T> getDefinition()
      Gets the definition for the argument
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getInvalidValues()
      Gets a list of any invalid values found for the argument
      Arguments getParentArguments()
      Gets the parent Arguments that contains this argument
      T getValue()
      Gets the value found for the argument If the argument was not specified, this method should return the argument definition default value (if specified) or simply return null.
      boolean hasInvalidValues()
      Whether any invalid values were found for the argument
      boolean isSpecified()
      Whether the argument was specified (found) during parsing
      void setRawValue(int tokenPosition, java.lang.String rawValue, ArgName specifiedArgName)
      Sets the value of the argument
      void setSeen()
      Denotes that the argument was seen (encountered) during parsing)
      void setSpecified()
      Denotes that the argument was specified (found) during parsing (without having to set an actual value - in the case of flag or informational type arguments)
      boolean wasSeen()
      Whether the argument was seen (even if it was invalid) during parsing (This flag is maintained so that multiple argument checkers can check if the argument was encountered at all - even if the value was invalid)

    • Method Detail

      • getDefinition

        ArgumentDefinition<T> getDefinition()
        Gets the definition for the argument
        Returns:
        the argument definition for the argument

      • isSpecified

        boolean isSpecified()
        Whether the argument was specified (found) during parsing
        Returns:
        whether the argument was specified

      • setSpecified

        void setSpecified()
        Denotes that the argument was specified (found) during parsing (without having to set an actual value - in the case of flag or informational type arguments)

      • wasSeen

        boolean wasSeen()
        Whether the argument was seen (even if it was invalid) during parsing (This flag is maintained so that multiple argument checkers can check if the argument was encountered at all - even if the value was invalid)
        Returns:
        whether the argument was seen

      • setSeen

        void setSeen()
        Denotes that the argument was seen (encountered) during parsing)

      • getValue

        T getValue()
        Gets the value found for the argument If the argument was not specified, this method should return the argument definition default value (if specified) or simply return null. If the argument was found multiple times, this method should return the first value found
        Returns:
        the found value (or default or null)

      • setRawValue

        void setRawValue(int tokenPosition,
                 java.lang.String rawValue,
                 ArgName specifiedArgName)
          throws BadArgException
        Sets the value of the argument
        Parameters:
        tokenPosition - the position of the token in args[]
        rawValue - the raw string value found in the command line args
        specifiedArgName - the name by which the arg was specified
        Throws:
        BadArgException - if the raw value cannot be converted to the appropriate type, or the value is invalid (or can be use to throw exception where a multiple value was found but not allowed)

      • getAllValues

        java.util.List<T> getAllValues()
        Gets a list of all the values found for the argument
        Returns:
        list of values found

      • hasInvalidValues

        boolean hasInvalidValues()
        Whether any invalid values were found for the argument
        Returns:
        whether any invalid values were found for the argument

      • getInvalidValues

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getInvalidValues()
        Gets a list of any invalid values found for the argument
        Returns:
        list of invalid values

      • addInvalidValue

        void addInvalidValue(java.lang.String invalidValue)
        Adds a found invalid value for the argument
        Parameters:
        invalidValue - the invalid value found

      • getParentArguments

        Arguments getParentArguments()
        Gets the parent Arguments that contains this argument
        Returns:
        the parent Arguments
